author: oising
body:
As per https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/3460

Added `[semver]` as a core (safe to use in constrained language mode) type accelerator for `System.Management.Automation.SemanticVersion`. 

Individual accelerators are not currently being tested, so no unit tests were added or updated.

comments.author: oising
comments.body: Yeah, it seems one of the New-TimeSpan tests is failing. It must have already been broken when I merged to rebase.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: @PaulHigin currently `SemanticVersion` is permitted in constrained language, please review if that's OK.

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body: @oising PowerShell core types are intended to be the absolute minimum needed in a constrained language interactive session.  Can you tell us the scenario where this type is needed and why constrained language is required?

comments.author: oising
comments.body: @PaulHigin I guess I included it in core types for the same reasons you guys included `[ModuleSpecification]`. Given that NuGet packages are a core (no pun intended) building block of CoreFX, and `[semver]` being a large part of their identity, it seemed like something that may be more useful than not. I know this is all a bit fuzzy, but it's just what made sense to me.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: @PaulHigin I think the rationale is that `SemanticVersion` is replacing `System.Version` ( the type of `$PSVersionTable.PSVersion` is `SemanticVersion`), so I think it makes sense to allow it in constrained language. But we need your expertise to inspect the implementation of `SemanticVersion` and see if it's safe to be exposed in constrained language.

comments.author: oising
comments.body: @daxian-dbw Yes, also good points. I took a cursory glance at the implementation and didn't see any red flags, but I'm also not privy to your criteria.

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body: Ok, I think this is reasonable.  I'll review for security safety.  Thanks.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: Filed #4221 to track adding tests for type accelerators in PowerShell.

title: added 'semver' as core type accelerator for S.M.A.SemanticVersion
